intro: Licaria capitata, commonly known as the clustered licaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and branching. Licaria capitata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
